refentry.refsection:
Description
A transform can be applied in two different ways, one to convert non-DocBook content to DocBook, and the other to transform DocBook content into a different instance of DocBook.
If the grammar attribute is specified, then the transform specified by the href attribute is applied to any resource elements with a matching grammar attribute to convert them to DocBook for inclusion. This could be used to convert DITA files to DocBook, for example.
If the name attribute is specified instead, then the transform is applied to any module whose output element includes a transform attribute whose value matches the name. This allows the content of a resource to be filtered or rearranged before being output to the assembled DocBook document.
Change the grammar attribute description to something like: "resource elements with a matching grammar attribute value will have this transform applied to them during assembly to convert them to DocBook".
Change the name attribute description to something like: "output elements with a matching transform attribute value will have this transform applied to the content of its parent module element when outputting the assembly."
A transform specifies a mechanism for converting one format into another during the assembly process. For example, if a module identifies a resource in a foreign grammar, then a transform can be used to identify the transformation that will convert the foreign grammar into DocBook.
Processing expectations
Never rendered.
